channel.title: What is layering?
channel.description: I've seen a lot of people talking about layering their leads to make better sounds (I guess). What is layering and how would you do it? Thanks!

item.title: What is layering?
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
I’m not professional in any way, shape, or form, but…I have been doing alot of research on chords, layering, and music theory. So here are some tips that I have found to help, and might possibly help you out as well.

  1. Drum layering: In a lot of videos and articles I have been reading, almost every artists explained about drum layering. In Auxy, each drum set can be recognized pretty easily because we all use them so much. But if you mix and mach different kicks, snares, highhats and cymbals from different sets, it surprisingly helps your track sound different and unique. Oh, forgot to mention, mixing and matching drum sets is totally easy, so no need to worry about anything complicated

  2. Synth layering: In allot of my song projects, my synth melodies are pretty simple and sometimes pretty boring. Something that helps allot is experimenting with different instruments at once. Try copying the loop over into other instruments, and play around with all the different sounds.

  3. Chords! : Chords to me are a pain in the butt! However, one tip that helped me out a bunch is messing around with panning. Lets say you have a chord Melody made with silk. Try copying the loop over (So you have 2 of the same silk instruments) Then with panning, pan one “Silk” all the way to the right, and the other “Silk” all the way to the left. It makes that chord sound really thick, and helps your track sound more complete.

  4. Just keep adding. Add stuff to it. Anything and everything. Rises, drops, transitions, anything!

Hope this wasn’t to confusing, here are some websites that have helped me out, and might help you too!

ProducerSpot – 4 May 17

Music Production HOT Tips: Layers & Layering • ProducerSpot

Read about some cool mixing tips on sound layering and how to improve your mix using sound layers. FL Studio examples of drum layering, vocals, synths, etc.


MusicRadar

12 sound layering tips and tricks

Learn to create thicker, cleaner sounds


ModeAudio

Layering Synths | ModeAudio Magazine

Our guide to layering synths to create a bigger, fuller, richer sound - one of our very top production tips!


BeatPlugBlog – 8 Feb 16

5 Quick tips to improve your Drum sample layering

To get better results drum layering can be a little more complex than just playing two or three sounds at the same time. Here are 5 quick tips that will help you improve your drum layering skills. …

P.S. Sorry for any spelling errors

Read full topic

item.title: What is layering?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I see what you mean. I don’t think mine are solid bars, as there’s generally movement in the composition.

But still, they’re probably locally quite muddy in the respective low/mid/hi parts of the mix. Need to swot up on carving out space with better sound design and EQ-ing.

Read full topic

item.title: What is layering?
item.dc:creator: NEWNAMES
item.description:
moemx:

However: I wouldn’t overdo the layering too much, since you’ll get some pretty nasty frequencies at s Me point (taking about headroom etc) - a song should be rich but think about some ‘space’ to breathe in between as well.

(me over here with my 6 chord layers )

item.title: What is layering?
item.dc:creator: DontPartyWithGuns
item.description:
1. Multiple basses merged into one bass

  2. Multiple synths merged into a new one

  3. Multiple drum layers for making drums audible in a loud drop (happens to me all the time :P)

item.title: What is layering?
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
Way back when on Soundcloud ,@southborne helped me with layering alot. He said “think of songs as having 3 different sound types. There’s bass frequency, mid frequency and high. you need to fill in each of these sound profiles in a song. adding chords will fill the mid” (That is a direct copy/paste from soundcloud Messages btw Lol) Hope this helps a bit

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
Yup, as above. Not only will you get richer sounds, but you can fiddle with lowpass and highpass to create different effects in the sounds you’re making. It’s all about creating original instruments, babeh

item.title: What is layering?
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Layering is just playing sounds at the same time.

A common approach is play the same thing on 2+ instruments at once. This is easy to do on Auxy, as you can simply duplicate an entire instrument (including notes / automation) and then change the instrument to something else.

Read full topic
